summ_a: This all suite hotel is flawless. Around the holidays season, the hotel was well decorated for X-mas with lovely Palm trees and Christmas lights. This hotel is so close to the beach and is perfectly located for peace and quiet. The airport and Duval street is only a short shuttle away, but downtown is quite far away. Morden rooms with great size and a lot of storage space. The beds are super comfortable. The bathroom is also pretty large with a nice vanity area. The staff were even willing to help with last minute late checkout request. The restaurant provides great food, but it closes too early for us. The hotel actually has bikes to rent. Parking close-by can be very pricey per day. The elevators feel not safe.
summ_b: This all suite hotel is impeccable, especially during the holiday season, when it is decorated with festive Christmas lights and palm trees. Its location is ideal for making the most of the peace and quiet, close to the beach and just a short shuttle ride away from the airport and Duval street -- though downtown is quite a trek. The rooms are modern with ample storage space and the beds are incredibly comfortable. The bathrooms are rather roomy too with a nice vanity area and the staff is accommodating, even to last minute requests for late check-out. The restaurant offers delicious food, though it closes quite early. The hotel even provides bikes for hire! However, nearby parking can be quite expensive for daily use. The elevators can feel a bit unsafe.
summ_comm: This hotel is completely spotless, especially during the Christmas season when it is brightened up with decorations like lights and palm trees. Its remote location is perfect for those looking for peace, being close to the beach and only a few minutes away from the airport and Duval street. The rooms are up-to-date with enough storage room, as well as super comfy beds. The bathrooms are huge, along with a nice vanity space, and the staff is always receptive to last minute requests. The restaurant has delicious food, even though it closes quite early. Furthermore, the hotel even provides people with bikes to hire. However, daily parking in the area can be quite expensive. The elevators can make you feel a bit worried.

summ_a: The hotel has an enjoyable ambience and is great value for money. This location is great if you're looking to access the great fun and action close-by, but with that comes hustle-and-bustle noise from the street the hotel is located on. The rustic rooms here are a little small but really comfortable and clean while the beds are big. There was a thatched roof to the room that provided an airy feel but of course not soundproof. The hotel provides great breakfast to be eaten above the garden or to take away. The hotel does not provide private parking unfortunately.
summ_b: The hotel is a great choice due to its pleasant atmosphere and cost-effectiveness. If you're looking for activities in the nearby vicinity, this is the spot for you. However, due to its street location, there may be some street noise to consider. The rustic rooms may be a bit constrained but comfortable and tidy. The beds are substantial. The room had a thatched roof, making it airy, but don't anticipate any soundproofing. A nice breakfast is provided to be enjoyed in the garden or to be taken out of the premises. Unfortunately, the hotel doesn't offer private vehicle parking.
summ_comm: This hotel brings you a pleasant ambiance along with a low cost. It has a great location that makes it easy to find nearby activities. Though, it's not without its share of street noise. Its rustic rooms aren't huge, but they're cozy, neat and have big beds. The rooms have thatched roofs making them naturally airy, but sound won't stay inside. To start your day, they give you a lovely breakfast to be eaten in the garden or packed to go. Sadly, you can't park privately on the property.

summ_a: This is a really great place to stay and it's really quiet. The station is really close to the hotel and it is located in an old monastery set in beautiful gardens. The rooms in the hotel are spacious, clean and with air conditioning. The food at the hotel is reasonably priced. The hotel lobby provides free wireless internet and you can also borrow one of their laptops if needed.
summ_b: Staying here is a great experience; it's so tranquil. The train station is conveniently located nearby, with the hotel nestled in a grand monastery surrounded by stunning gardens. Room sizes are generous, kept tidy and have good air-conditioning. Prices for the meals at the hotel are affordable. Plus, the lobby has free wireless connection and computers for borrow.
summ_comm: Living in this place is a remarkable experience, with the soothing atmosphere. The hotel is located close to the train station, situated inside an impressive monastery with gorgeous gardens near it. The rooms are all spacious, neat, and climate-controlled. Additionally, the meals served at the hotel are reasonably-priced. Furthermore, the lobby has readily-available Wi-Fi and computers which can be

summ_a: If you're looking for a decent clean hotel then this is the right one for you because it provides a pleasant and unforgettable experience. This is a nice location because you can even see the Colosseum from the hotel, which itself is less than a ten minute walk away. The rooms in the hotel are nicely decorated, although some may find the bed small. The day staff spoke English. The hotel has a continental buffet breakfast with good cappuccino available on the roof terrace. The breakfast is very tasty. The showers in the hotel bathrooms are a little small.
summ_b: If you're in search of a satisfactory and decent hotel, this is the place for you. It offers an enjoyable and lasting experience. This property has a great location, as the Colosseum can be seen from the building and it is a short walk away. The accommodations are impeccably decorated, but the beds may be deemed small by some. The customer service personnel speaks the English language. There is an extensive continental breakfast available on the rooftop terrace, featuring great cappuccino and flavorsome dishes. The bathrooms have somewhat tiny showers.
summ_comm: If you're looking for a satisfactory and suitable hotel, this is the one. They offer a pleasant and lasting stay. The location of the property is ideal, with the Colosseum being in sight of the building and a short walk away. The guestrooms are elegantly decorated, though some may view the beds as too small. The hotel staff are able to converse in the English language. They have a fabulous continental breakfast on the rooftop terrace, which includes delicious cappuccino and scrumptious dishes. Unfortunately, the bathrooms have mini showers.

summ_a: This is a great condo that was comfortable, convenient, and much nicer than staying in a hotel. It would be a shame not to come back again. The location of the hotel is perfectly situated on the lake and there is the option to rent boats down at Indian Point if needed. Fantastic views. As well as being really helpful the staff at this hotel were super friendly and nice. The units facing the lake had large covered patios to enjoy your coffee on. There is only one complaint and that is the people in the room above were up all night long, but that is the only downside to this hotel.
summ_b: This condo was an incredible experience - comfortable, convenient, and much more pleasant than a hotel. It would be regrettable not to come back again, especially due to how perfectly the hotel rests beside the lake, with the possibility of renting boats from Indian Point. The sights were remarkable, and to top it off the staff at the hotel were beyond friendly. The units overlooking the lake had big patios suitable for enjoying a cup of coffee. The only negative was the people staying in the room on the upper floor who were loudly up all night, but that was the sole downside to this fabulous condo.
summ_comm: It was such a delight to stay in this condo, with it being much more preferable than that of a hotel. Experiencing the tranquility of the lake, alongside the ability to hire boats from Indian Point, made it all the more worthwhile. The views were remarkable, and there was nothing the hotel staff could do more to make everyone more comfortable. Even the balconies set overlooking the lake are perfect for a relaxing cup of coffee. The only downside, unfortunately, was the people in the upper floor who kept everyone up all night with their noise levels, however, this did not combat the wonderful time at this condo.

summ_a: The room featured WiFi and Apple TV, which was a great touch. Additionally the shower was excellent. The only negatives really are the pillows were pretty full and there was no refrigerator in the room. The staff at the hotel were polite and accommodating. The sales manager that was contacted was efficient in response and helpful with suggestions. There are great food options around the hotel but the breakfast in the connected restaurant was really great. The second floor of the hotel was recently refurbished and quiet.
summ_b: The room was equipped with WiFi and Apple TV, which was great. The shower was satisfying, although the pillows were quite stiff and there was no refrigerator. The staff at the hotel were friendly and accommodating, and the sales manager contacted was very effective at responding and providing helpful advice. There were great restaurants close by the hotel, but the breakfast at the one attached was particularly great. The second story of the hotel had recently been refurbished and was very quiet.
summ_comm: The accommodation had WiFi and Apple TV available, which was great, and overall the shower was satisfactory. Despite this, the pillows were quite firm and unfortunately there was no refrigerator. The staff at the hotel were friendly and willing to help, and the sales manager contacted was highly responsive, providing useful assistance. There were restaurants around the area, though the attached one had a particularly delicious breakfast. The second floor of the hotel had recently been refurbished and was particularly tranquil.

summ_a: Overall the hotel is a really unique place to stay. The location is pretty good but doesn't have great access to a subway line. There's mainstream shopping and the theatre quarters close-by though which adds to how good the location is. The shower in the room was very modern. Most of the staff were friendly to guests. This hotel has a small restaurant that provides superb food that very proudly uses local and organic produce. The hotel has an archaic elevator which is a novelty.
summ_b: This hotel has a one-of-a-kind feel to it and is situated in a convenient area, despite not having a subway near by. Shopping centers and theaters are just a few blocks away, enhancing its location. The bathroom features cutting-edge features, and most of the staff were hospitable. The in-house eatery offers outstanding food made with locally sourced, organic ingredients. Added to that, the old-fashioned elevator provides an interesting experience.
summ_comm: This hotel provides a distinctive atmosphere and an advantageous spot, even without a subway station in the vicinity. It is a few blocks from department stores and cinemas, making it even more eye-catching. The modernized bathroom amenities are appealing, and the majority of the staff members were warmly welcoming. To boot, the restaurant in the hotel serves exquisite meals composed of local and organic components. Additionally, the classic lift provides a unique adventure.

summ_a: Some would recommend the hotel to others, although some may not. The hotel is ideally situated for transportation routes like the St. Charles line but also in walking distance of the Garden District and a bit further to the French Quarter. The hotel has spacious rooms equipped with a kitchen. The rooms are very clean but the bathrooms are rather small. The shower was excellent. The staff at the hotel were incredibly helpful , particularly the welcoming porters. There is lots of great tasting food available to eat around this hotel. The hotel provides wristbands for entry into the premises which is a pleasing security feature.
summ_b: Many people are divided on their opinion of the hotel, yet it remains in a convenient position for buses on the St. Charles line, as well as being close to the Garden District and a bit farther from the French Quarter. The rooms are roomy, with a kitchen included and kept nicely clean, with the exception of somewhat small bathrooms. The showers, however, were fantastic. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly, especially the front desk porters. The eateries close by were tasty and the hotel's use of wristbands for entry is a nice security feature.
summ_comm: People have different feelings about this hotel, but it is located near buses on St. Charles Avenue and also close to the Garden District but not too far from the French Quarter. The rooms are spacious and include a kitchen, which was pretty neat and clean, save for the bathrooms which were a bit tiny. On the other hand, the showers were great. The people working there were both welcoming and helpful, particularly the front desk workers. The eateries nearby were all delicious and the hotel's use of a wristband for entry was a nice security touch.

summ_a: This hotel makes for a really pleasant and delightful stay. You wouldn't want to stay anywhere else if returning to Venice. The hotel is perfectly situated to get to great restaurants and it's close to water-ferry stations. The room in the hotel had a spacious, newly decorated bathroom and a quiet room in general. The rooms are decorated with a respect for history. The breakfast was a little bit basic but it was still a good start to the day with continental-style yoghurts, cereals etc. The hotel is great value for money.
summ_b: This hotel provides a delightful and delightful stay. If you come back to Venice, you would not want to stay in any other place. It is ideally located to access some wonderful restaurants and it's in close proximity to water transportation stops. The accommodation in the hotel presented a nicely decorated bathroom, and an ambient room. The decorations respected the historical heritage. The morning meal wasn't extravagant yet it still allowed a nice start to the day with continental yogurt, cereal, and more. The hotel provides guests with amazing value for the cost they pay.
summ_comm: Visiting this hotel guarantees a satisfactory and memorable experience. Whenever you come to Venice, you shouldn't consider sleeping anywhere else! It is conveniently located near a variety of excellent restaurants, and it's close to public transport stops. The guestrooms are wonderfully decorated and the atmosphere is cozy. All the decorations also honor the city's history. Although the breakfast wasn't extravagant, you can enjoy delicious continental favorites like yogurt, cereal, and more. You'll get unbeatable value for your money when you stay in this hotel!

summ_a: This is a decent place to stay and will leave you feeling happy overall. Initially there was a bit of a rough start here at the hotel but still a nice hotel. There is some peace and quiet here at this hotel but it is still quite close to the action with restaurants and shopping nearby. The room was clean with adequate disabled access , but it may take a while to get access to the room. The staff here are okay and mostly very helpful. They do enforce valet parking however which is a little offputting. Dinner at this hotel was really good and pleasing. There are also other food options nearby such as a restaurant that serves Italian food. There was a small outdoor patio which unfortunately overlooked the pool and other patios and that made it quite noisy. There are valet and parking services available too.
summ_b: This place is quite pleasant and sure to leave you satisfied overall. At first it was a bit rocky, but it is still a nice hotel. You do get some peace and quiet here but there are also some activities such as eateries and retailers close by. The accommodation was neat with adequate disabled access, although it could take a bit a while to get in. The staff are all right, usually being very helpful. Though they do use valet parking, which can be a bit annoying. The restaurant at the hotel had a good taste and there are also other restaurants, such as an Italian cuisine spot, in the neighborhood. There was a small patio outside, however it was quite noisy as it overlooked the pool and other patios. Valet and parking facilities can be utilized.
summ_comm: This hotel is quite welcoming and guaranteed to make your stay satisfactory overall. It started out a little shaky, but it is still a great place. You can have some alone time here, but there are also nearby eateries and retailers. The room was kept clean and well-equipped for disabled access, although getting in could take a little bit of time. The staff are alright, generally being very obliging. However, valet parking can be quite tedious. The restaurant inside the hotel had excellent food, and there are other places to eat, including an Italian eatery, in the surrounding area. There was an outdoor seating area, but it was a bit noisy as it faced the pool and other outdoor areas. Valet and parking are both available.

summ_a: The hotel is nicely located in a quiet canal street with being only walkable distance to many interesting places like Dam Square and Anne Franks House. While the room is quite small, the view of the canal was wonderful. You should try to request a large rom, although the small room did have a big enough bathroom. The staff at the reception and breakfast area were rude and not very helpful. Although with a reasonable price, the breakfast has very limited quantity and the food tasted funny. The shower was scallding dangerously.
summ_b: The hotel is situated in a peaceful canal street, conveniently close enough by to walk to lots of historic sights like the Dam Square and Anne Franks House. The room itself was rather tiny but it afforded you a fantastic view of the canal. It would be best to book a bigger room, though the small room had a surprisingly large bathroom. The personnel at the reception desk and breakfast room were not at all friendly and their service was quite appalling. Despite its low cost, the breakfast selection was sparse and the food not up to very much.
summ_comm: This hotel is located adjacent to some of the city's most iconic spots, like the Dam Square and Anne Franks House and is set along a tranquil canal. Unfortunately, the room itself was diminutive, however, it featured a captivating view of the canal. We suggest reserving a bigger room as the one we stayed in had a surprisingly large bathroom. Furthermore, the reception and breakfast personnel were far from friendly and their hospitality was dreadful. Additionally, considering the cost, the breakfast options were poor quality and limited.

summ_a: Really recommended to anyone. This well-maintained hotel has good facilities, upscale but cozy vibe, and lovely courtyard and pool. This hotel sits in a perfect location and in walking distance to all the key landmarks. The rooms are clean and the bed is super comfortable. The only issue was the shower in the bathroom, which would spray outside the stall. The service was outstanding in general; the staff here at this hotel are both helpful as well as professional. But there were some small teething problems , for example the housekeeping staff don't work after midnight. The hotel offered really chocolates and gingersnaps in the lobby and free breakfast. Lovely pool area. The valet parking should be provided.
summ_b: Highly recommended to anyone. This well-kept hotel feature great amenities, comfortable but luxurious vibes, and a wonderful courtyard and pool. It is in just the right location and a short walk to all the main attractions. The rooms are spotless and the mattress is incredibly comfortable. The only issue was the shower, which had some leakage outside the cubicle. The service was generally excellent; the staff here are both accommodating and professional. There were a few minor hiccups, such as the cleaning staff not functioning after 12am. Additionally, the hotel had wonderful chocolates and germsnaps in the lobby and free breakfast. The pool area was great. Valet parking should be an available service.
summ_comm: It is strongly recommended to check out this well-kept hotel that provides magnificent amenities, a relaxed yet upscale atmosphere, and a stunning courtyard and pool. Being in a prime spot and only short jaunt away from all the major sites, it is a worthwhile stay. The rooms are pristine and the bedding is extremely cozy. The only issue we noticed was a slight leak from the shower. The service was top-notch and the personnel were both accommodating and professional. There were minimal glitches like the cleaning crew not being accessible after midnight. In addition, the lobby had complimentary chocolate and german cookies and a continental breakfast. The pool area was amazing. It would be helpful to have a valet parking service.

summ_a: It is a charming European hotel. The hotel is situated on the River Arno and is a quiet locale. The hotel rooms were well decorated and with fully functioning air conditioning. It was definitely a room with a view. The staff here at this hotel are really great and the manager was also really knowledgeable for local outings. They all work hard to please and meet your needs. You can access the internet via a computer in the hotel lobby and this is a free option. There is also a great hotel balcony, which was lovely to sit on and watch the world go by.
summ_b: This European hotel has a great location directly on the River Arno, providing guests with a tranquil and pleasant atmosphere. The hotel rooms were lavishly outfitted, including a functioning air conditioning unit, and offered a fantastic view. The employees of the hotel were incredibly helpful and the supervisor was familiar with interesting sights and activities nearby. Additionally, visitors can use the computer in the hotel lobby free of charge to access the internet. On top of that, there is a lovely balcony which is the perfect spot for guests to relax and observe their surroundings.
summ_comm: This European hotel has a prime location situated along the River Arno, providing a relaxed and pleasant ambiance to anyone that stays there. The hotel rooms were luxuriously decorated, featuring air conditioning, and offered wonderful sights. The staff were extremely beneficial and the manager was knowledgeable on exciting places and adventures nearby. In addition, visitors can take advantage of the computer in the lobby with no fees in order to get online. Furthermore, there is a beautiful terrace which is a wonderful place for travelers to unwind and take in their environment.

summ_a: The hotel is ideal for a boisterous and young crowd, such as a girl's trip. The hotel is close to bus routes into the city and is a good change of place to stay from the downtown alternatives. The hotel is located in the centre of Lincoln Park with restaurants and a good night life. The hotel itself is located on Clark Street which is a shoppers' delight. The hotel has double beds in the single rooms which is great for one or two people. The rooms are very clean although the drain in the shower needs some attention.The hotel provided a good breakfast to guests. The hotel has good security, as your key card is needed to gain access to elevators or stairwells. There is free WiFi provided too. There was some street noise but not loud enough to cause concern. It is worth mentioning that it is difficult to park for the valet out front of the hotel.
summ_b: This hotel is a great option for the younger and more spirited crowd, such as a girl's trip. It is conveniently located near bus stops into the city centre and offers views and proximity to a number of restaurants and activities in Lincoln Park. Clark Street, which is within walking distance of the hotel, is also a consumer's paradise. The single bedrooms come with two beds, making them suitable for one or two people, and the cleanliness of the rooms, apart from some drain problems in the showers, was top notch. There are also two important amenities for guests at this hotel- a hearty breakfast, and reliable security which requires the use of a key card to enter into certain elevators and stairwells. Plus, the WiFi is free! The only thing worth noting is the limited parking availability, as well as some street noise, but it's minor enough to be barely noticeable.
summ_comm: This lodging is a great choice for vibrant groups of people, such as a girls' trip. It is close to bus stops into the downtown and has views and is close to numerous dining places and attractions in Lincoln Park. Clark Street is not far away either, which is a shopper's paradise. The single rooms provide both beds, so they can be used by one person or two and the toilet was very clean besides some trouble with the drain in the shower. There are two exemplary amenities for visitors of the hotel - an ample breakfast and well-rounded security that requires an access card for certain lifts and stairs. Furthermore, the Wi-Fi is complimentary. The only thing to mention is that there is minimal parking space and some street noise but they are minute and pretty much unnoticeable.

summ_a: The hotel is beautiful but expensive. There are normally a lot of guests at the hotel as it is popular. The rooms in the hotel are comfortable and come equipped with a DVD player. The service was truly exceptional from the staff who were all always pleasant. The hotel did not provide much selection of food or anything that was really fresh. The hotel has signature peanut shells on the floor which are a slipping hazard. The toilets around the corner are below Singapore standards.
summ_b: The hotel is stunning but costly. It has a lot of visitors since it is widely liked. The bedrooms are comfortable and come with a DVD player. The staff members' service was perfect, always cheerful. Unfortunately, the hotel does not have a great selection of food and some of it was not very fresh. What was hazardous, though, were the peanut shells on the ground. The toilets near the corner are not up to Singapore's standards.
summ_comm: The hotel is lovely, but pricey. It is immensely popular with many visitors staying due to its fantastic reputation. The bedrooms are cozy and come with a DVD player. The employees provided exemplary service, all of whom were amazingly cheerful. Unfortunately, the food was not all good as some of it wasn't very fresh. What was concerning, though, were the peanut shells littered on the ground. The restrooms located at the corner do not reach Singapore's standards.

summ_a: This hotel gives a mix of luxury and odd unsafe feeling. The location was fine. It is on the outskirts of downtown and close to everything you need: it is steps away from Eaton Centre, Yonge Street, and great shopping areas. However, the blocks surrounding it aren't ideal. The hotel staff pleasantly provided lots of great local recommendations. The food here is okay including the hot and cold options for breakfast buffet. It is worth checking restaurants across the road as well. This hotel provides so many amazing additions, such as a nice swimming pool with hot tubs and locker room facilities, a beautiful roof top space with plenty of seating, and complementary internet access. The only downside is the expensive underground parking.
summ_b: This hotel offers a luxurious experience but some may find it uneasy due to its location. Being just steps away from the Eaton Centre, Yonge Street, and other various shopping areas, it has convenient placement. Sadly, the blocks surrounding the hotel may not be up to par. However, the friendly staff were more than willing to provide travelers with local tips and recommendations. As far as food goes, the hot and cold options served at the breakfast buffet are okay but it may be worth looking into what restaurants across the street have to offer. The hotel also has several great amenities making it a desirable place to stay such as its swimming pool with hot tubs and locker room facilities, a stunning roof top seating area, and Wi-Fi access
summ_comm: This hotel offers a grand stay, though some may have reservations due to its locality. Being just a few steps away from the Eaton Centre, Yonge Street, and several other shopping areas, it is certainly easy-to-reach. Unfortunately, the neighborhood may not be entirely appealing. Nonetheless, the hotel personnel was more than happy to offer tourists useful tips and takes on the area. As for grub, the warm and cold dishes available at the morning buffet are acceptable, but you may want to check out what restaurants across the street have to provide. Moreover, great services such as a swimming pool with hot tubs and lockers, an amazing roof top seating area, and Wi-Fi are all provided—making this an ideal vacation place.

summ_a: The hotel was attractive and clean. The hotel is situated next to the train station but also next to the fire department which can make it noisy. There are lots of bars nearby. The hotel rooms are clean and comfortable, although perhaps in need of a slight touch up and redecoration. The room had good disabled access, including the bath. The hotel provides a free breakfast buffet in the morning, as well as free hot drinks all day, which is popular with families staying. The hotel is also close to Rock Bottom Brewery, which serves really good food. The hotel can provide early check-in instead of waiting later, which was a nice gesture.
summ_b: The hotel had a pleasant appearance and was immaculate. It was conveniently located by the railway station and close to the fire department, generating some noise. The area was populated with plenty of pubs. The accommodation was clean and inviting, though it could benefit from a refresh. The restroom was wheelchair friendly, inclusive of the bathtub. Every morning, visitors could feast on a complimentary breakfast spread and hot beverages for the entire day - a great option for groups. Within short walking distance, Rock Bottom Brewery let out sensational meals. If arrival was earlier than expected, the hotel could also provide early check-in, which was a considerate gesture.
summ_comm: The hotel was attractive and well-kept. Its nearness to the railway station and fire department made it the ideal spot, though it did have some noise due to the busy area. The guest rooms were inviting and comfortable, yet they could use an upgrade. The wheelchair accessible bathroom, complete with a bathtub, was a nice touch. Every morning, guests could enjoy a complimentary breakfast and hot drinks for the whole day, making it well suited for groups. Rock Bottom Brewery, which was just a brief stroll away, provided delicious meals. Additionally, if individuals needed to check-in early, the hotel was more than willing to accommodate them.

summ_a: The hotel has all the modern conveniences but is set out in a classical style. It's super easy to access the city centre from this hotel, making it a great hotel for location. At this hotel some rooms are very elegant and quiet with comfortable beds and even a fireplace. The shower was great, too, but the walls are really thin. The hotel even provides car service. The hotel provided some great food and every dish tasted great. Unfortunately the taps on the sinks were pretty tight and because it is an older building there seemed to be no soundproofing.
summ_b: This hotel has all the updated amenities, but is decorated in a traditional fashion. It is incredibly quick and easy to get to the downtown area, making it an ideal choice for location. The rooms are very grand and tranquil, including comfortable beds and fireplaces. The showers were remarkable, however the walls were quite thin. In addition, it offers car service. Not only was the cuisine scrumptious but all dishes were delectable. Unfortunately, the sink faucets were quite stiff and since it is an older structure, there was no soundproofing.
summ_comm: This hotel boasts up-to-date facilities, but with a classic look. It is conveniently located close to the downtown area. The rooms have a luxurious and peaceful atmosphere and include features like comfortable mattresses and fireplaces. The showers had amazing quality, but the walls were fairly thin. Besides, they provide a car service option. The food is wonderful, and all the dishes tasted great. Unfortunately, the sink faucets were a bit trickey to use and due to its age, there was no soundproofing.

summ_a: This is overall a really great hotel but a bit pricey. It could be quite disturbing if you stay on the front of the hotel due to the horns from the street. The location of this hotel is absolutely great and central, you can walk to many shops, Gaudi 's Casa Batllo , and la Pedrera. The metro station is also really close. A standard room at this hotel is smaller than expected, with most of the space being taken by the huge but very comfortable bed inside. The bathrooms was outdated and need some updating. The room service was overpriced. Unfortunately the hotel's breakfast definitely not worth the money. The lifts were a bit inconvenient and request long time wait because there are only two of small and infrequent ones. Also, the rooms facing courtyard at the back are quieter than the ones to the front.
summ_b: This hotel was overall really great, but a bit expensive. If you stay on the front side, the horns from the street might be bothersome. The location was very central, so you could walk to attractions like Gaudi's Casa Batllo and La Pedrera. The metro was also close by. The standard room was smaller than anticipated, and the bed took up a lot of the space, but it was comfortable. The bathrooms need some updating, and the room service was costly. The breakfast was not worth the money. The lifts were slow and waiting long periods of time was common since there were only two of them. Staying in a room that faces the courtyard at the back of the hotel ensures more quietness than those at the front.
summ_comm: This hotel was quite good, but it was quite costly. Being situated in the city center, you can take a walk to Gaudi's Casa Batllo and La Pedrera. The metro station is close, too. The standard space was not as big as expected, and the bed filled up a big part of the area, but it was very comfortable. Things like bathroom fixtures and the room service rates should be improved. Additionally, the breakfast didn't deserve the money they asked. The elevators were slow and passengers had to wait a lot of time, because there were only two of them. If you choose a room facing the courtyard in the back, you will have more peacefulness than the ones that face the street in the front.

summ_a: The hotel had a spa and pools that made it a relaxing time during the stay. The hotel was clean and there were also figures made of ice to see. The hotel is ideally located to explore local restaurants and bars in the area. The room was large and featured a flat-screen high-definition television. The hotel room was always very clean and toiletries were always provided upon asking. The price of the food is quite off-putting and they could improve what they offer. Despite being fairly pricey there were really stunning atria with various wildlife to see.
summ_b: The hotel had a spa and pools that provided a relaxing atmosphere during the stay. In addition to the cleanliness of the property, the figures made of ice were a delightful surprise. Its location made it easy to enjoy the local restaurants, bars and wildlife nearby. The room was sizable with a flat-screen high-definition television, and all toiletries were made readily available upon request. Unfortunately, the food prices were quite expensive and could be improved. Nevertheless, the vibrant atria were breathtaking with a variety of wildlife to view.
summ_comm: Staying at the hotel, guests could experience a tranquil atmosphere between the spa and the pools. Plus, the property was pristine, and surprising sculptures made of ice decorating the lobby. Its prime location made it easy to explore the nearby restaurants, bars and animals. The room was roomy, having a flat-screen, HD television and toiletries were immediately provided after asking. However, the food prices were rather steep and could use some adjustments. In any case, the vibrant atriums were a sight to behold, with various wildlife around.

The hotel has a roof terrace for drinks. Unfortunately the hotel is missing the availability of a pool.

The bathrooms are especially large, some with bathtubs, and small amenities like a chocolate on the pillow make it feel especially homey. For refreshment, there is a roof terrace bar. The only downside is the lack of a pool.

summ_a: The hotel is tranquil and clean and overall an enjoyable place to stay whilst in Rome. The hotel is close to a number of local restaurants and the busier areas of Rome. The hotel's corridors were quite plain and could benefit from some decoration. The free Wi-Fi worked well and the Bulgari toiletries smelled lovely.

summ_a: This is a great place for a short stay and it will likely make you want to come back again. The hotel isn't really central. The area is quite safe so really the location is pretty good. summ_a: The hotel is decent and a great choice if looking for a cheap, clean, and secure place to stay. The hotel is close to the Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque and the tram lines for transport around the city. The rooms are pretty comfortable but this room in particularly constantly had smoke blowing up from the lobby. The staff at the hotel provided a good service. The hotel had breakfast included in the price of the stay. One thing to note with the hotel is that there is only a one way transfer, so you will have to pay for either the pick up or the drop off to the airport.
summ_b: If you're looking for somewhere with affordability, cleanliness, and security, the hotel is a good option. Located close to the Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque, and various tram lines, you'll have easy access to public transport throughout the city. The rooms are comfortable, but unfortunately, smoke often wafts up from the lobby. The staff proved to be welcoming and accommodating, and the cost of the stay includes breakfast. The only caveat is that they offer one-way transfers, so you'll have to pay for the airport pick-up or drop-off separately.
summ_comm: If you're searching for a cost-effective, hygienic, and secure stay, then this hotel would be a suitable choice. Not far from the Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque and offering several tram lines, you will have handy access to the city's public transportation. The rooms are comfortable, but unfortunately guests can smell smoke from the lobby. The staff were pleasant and accommodating, and the overnight rate includes a complimentary breakfast. The only downside is that they only provide one-way transfers, so there is an additional fee required for the airport drop off and pick up.

summ_a: The facilities of this hotel are really great and therefore it's one of the most enjoyable stays. The location of the hotel was rather disappointing and not a very scenic area of Hong Kong. The hotel's rooms are adequate, although perhaps a little darkly lit. The rooms are clean and quiet, although for a more updated room it is worth booking a room on the Club floor. There is nothing the staff find to be too much trouble. The buffet breakfast is absolutely amazing and really varied. In addition the restaurant provides some really good food that's worth trying. The hotel has a bi-hourly bus shuttle service available to guests. It is not worth getting a hotel with a pool as it is often not the climate for swimming etc.
summ_b: This hotel is an enjoyable place to stay, thanks to its excellent facilities. Unfortunately, the location isn't the best and the scenery isn't so great. The guest rooms are decent, but could use a bit more brightness. They are still clean and peaceful, however, and if you'd like the most modern accommodation you should book the Club floor. The hospitality of the staff could not be faulted - they go out of their way to help. The breakfast buffet is delightful and varied, and the restaurant also offers some tasty food. If you need to go somewhere, there's a bus shuttle with departures every two hours that's free for guests. Lastly, while a pool would be nice, it's not the most practical addition given the local climate.

The rooms are decent, albeit a bit on the dim side, still they are immaculately clean and tranquil. For the most up-to-date lodging, reserve the Club floor. The staff are extremely welcoming and helpful, and the breakfast and restaurant food is delightful. Every two hours, there is a free shuttle bus for guests to use to get around. A swimming pool would be a bonus, but unfortunately it isn't realistic given the climate.

summ_a: A unique hotel that provides a similarly unique and unforgettable experience. It can't be recommended highly enough for the convenience and friendliness here. The location is superb. summ_a: Highly recommended hotel that you will want to come back to because it is definitely five-star. The hotel is only a minute from the beach in both directions. The hotel also has a rooftop pool with a view of the sea too. The hotel is located near to the Port Olympic and Barcelonetta. There is also a fitness park a two minute walk away. The hotel room had a good bathroom, but the pillows and linen were a bit uncomfortable. The bed was a good size and there was a large TV, WiFi etc. The room was specious and clean and also had a sea view. The food was really good here especially the breakfast. Sometimes the restaurant did not open for dinner but the chef would be flexible for a small party, which is great. The pools were a great addition to this hotel as well at the fitness centre. There's even a Jacuzzi on the rooftop, which was really fun.
summ_b: This hotel is an absolute must-visit. Only a stone's throw away from the beach, the Port Olympic and Barcelonetta, this five-star establishment is sure to make you want to come back again. Boasting a stunning rooftop pool with a view of the sea, a fitness park two minutes away and a top-notch Jacuzzi on the rooftop, its features add to the overall star-rated experience. While the room had an excellent bathroom, its pillows and linen were a bit uncomfortable. The bed was great and there was plenty of space in the room and it was clean, with a sea view to top it off. The food here was really good too, particularly the breakfast, and if the restaurant wasn't open for dinner, the chef was flexible for small groups.
summ_comm: This hotel is a definite spot you don't want to miss! Just a short distance away from the Port Olympic, the Barcelonetta and the ocean, it is a five-star destination that will definitely keep you coming back. Delight in the beautiful ocean view from the rooftop pool, indulge in the Jacuzzi, and break a sweat at the nearby fitness park. The restroom was especially impressive, though unfortunately, the bedding and pillows were not as comfortable as expected. The room also had plenty of floor space and a stunning seaside view. To complete the satisfaction, the meals here were excellent, especially the breakfast, although the restaurant could not open for dinner, the chef was still willing to cater to smaller groups.

summ_a: The hotel was great and comes highly recommended. The hotel is close to transport networks. The modern rooms were really clean. Yet, the complimentary breakfast fails to meet expectations, but guests can adjust the temperature as needed.

summ_a: It's a good hotel and would definitely recommend as well as return for another stay. The hotel is in a perfect location in the old quarter of Istanbul. The hotel is within minutes of the Blue Mosque and the Grand Bazaar, along with many other traditional and historic places in Sultanahmet. The rooms here are cosy and on the small side but always very clean and comfortable enough. The staff were knowledgeable about the local area. Although the rooms are small, they are kept clean and comfortable. Moreover, the staff had extensive knowledge of the local area. Additionally, the breakfast was truly remarkable and served on an outdoor terrace. Aside from this, free internet access was offered at the reception. All in all, I cannot find one thing to dislike about this hotel.

Even if the rooms are somewhat cramped, they were clean and cozy. Furthermore, the staff was incredibly knowledgeable about the area. summ_a: The price of staying at this hotel was reasonable. The hotel is located in the city centre and right next to a canal. The rooms of the hotel can be small and with little beds. The rooms are good value and are clean and well furnished. The continental breakfast was a bit limited but it did taste great and it was provided by the hotel for free. The hotel did provide free internet access. However, be warned of the steep stairs if you have heavy luggage. The hotel is gay friendly, but there are homosexual pornographic materials left out in public areas.

The rooms are not spacious and the beds can be small, but they are nicely priced and well maintained with neat furnishings. The continental breakfast served was somewhat restricted in quantity, but it was scrumptious and free to hotel guests. Free Wi-Fi is available. Be warned of the steep steps if you have heavy baggage. The continental breakfast was not abundant but it was delicious and complimentary for hotel-goers. Wi-Fi is free of charge. A warning for those carrying bulky suitcases: the stairs at this hotel are steep. summ_a: The hotel is situated about five minutes away from the airport and offers a free shuttle service to the downtown area at twenty minutes past the hour. The two-bedroom suite in this hotel was stunning and really impressive. There were lots of nice features such as granite worktops, marble flooring, stainless steel appliances for guest use, and the bathroom featured Jacuzzi tubs and a really big walk-in shower. The breakfast passes only included the fruit and bread. The parking facility at the hotel cost $18 which is expensive, and the water at the hotel was discoloured and riddled with seaweed.

Guests who stayed in the two-bedroom suite were amazed at how impressive it was, showcasing luxurious features like a granite worktop, marble floors and stainless steel kitchen appliances. Additionally, the bathroom included Jacuzzi tubs and a roomy walk-in shower. Unfortunately, the breakfast passes were only limited to fruit and bread, and parking here cost an expensive $18. Furthermore, the water quality was sub par, being discoloured and filled with seaweed.

Visitors that occupied the two-bedroom suite were amazed by its extravagance, with gorgeous granite worktop, polished marble surfaces and up-to-date kitchen appliances. The bathroom housed a mini-spa with Jacuzzi tubs and a capacious walk-in shower. Unfortunately, the breakfast options were limited to fruit and bread and there was an expensive fee of $18 to park here. Appallingly, the water quality was poor, being clouded and containing seaweed.

summ_a: This lovely and charming hotel can be busy during September time. This hotel is nicely located in quiet neighborhood and also close to the best things to do in Venice. While the breakfast is basic here the breakfast area is quite small and it gets filled up fast, there are lots of places near by; the staff will even make a reservation for you. The local boat trip to Murano is worth it but the advice would be to go on the normal boat.

The owners are very hospitable and the morning meal is simple, but the breakfast area is particularly small so it gets filled up quickly. However, there are nearby cafes and the staff will even make reservations for you. The boat trip to Murano is worth it, although it is suggested to go with the normal boat.

Although the accommodations were tidy, in order to acquire a higher quality stay, an additional €20 was required. The proprietors of the hotel are very welcoming and the buffet-style breakfast is basic however the area for dining is much too tiny for the amount of guests and fills up rapidly. Nevertheless, there are close-by restaurants and the front desk personnel will make reservations for you. The boat trip to Murano is suggested as a must-see although it is preferred to choose the regular boat.

The buffet breakfasts and dinners in this hotel is absolutely superb and there is even an a la carte lunch option. If that wasn't enough there is a great bar on the ground floor with really good tasty food, too. The internet provided at the hotel was of poor quality because it was so unreliable and you had to put a down-payment just to connect. However, there is a pool here at the hotel and that's really clean and of good quality.

The rooms in this hotel are clean, although they may appear a little antiquated, and are quite chilly. The buffet breakfast and dinner are fantastic, and a la carte lunch options are available. Additionally, a dependable bar with yummy food is located on the ground floor. The internet service here is inadequate, as it is costly to connect and very unreliable. Although the quality of the pool is top-notch if that provides any consolation.

The rooms in the hotel are clean although they may seem relatively outdated, and it can be quite chilly. The complimentary breakfast and dinner is amazing and à la carte lunch choices are obtainable. There is also a dependable bar with delicious dishes at the ground level. The internet here is not the best since it is expensive to sign up for and it is not reliable. Although the pool facilities are top-notch if that is any consolation.

summ_a: The hotel's furnishings is a bit outdated and need updating but it was very clean. This hotel has great central location; it is very close to many attractions, like MRT, Clarke Quay , and the National Museum. The bed was comfortable and the full size bath was a nice bonus. The isolation is bad so the elevator and neighbor speaking could be heard very clearly. The other downside is the lack of style and no wifi in the room. Disappointing breakfast. Very limited choices with no fresh fruit. This hotel has a very small pool.
summ_b: The accommodations at this hotel are a bit out of date and could use a refresh, but it was very clean. It has a great central location near public transit, Clarke Quay and the National Museum. The bed was comfortable and the full bath was a nice touch. However, soundproofing is poor, so noises from the elevator and from neighbors were very audible. Additionally, there is a lack of aesthetic style and no wifi in the rooms. The breakfast does not meet expectations with a limited number of choices and nothing fresh. It does however have a small pool.
summ_comm: The rooms of this hotel could do with an upgrade, however it was tidy. It has a great spot close to public transport, Clarke Quay, and the National Museum. The bed was comfy and the full bathroom was a nice addition. Unfortunately the sound insulation isn't very effective, meaning the lift and ambient noise coming from other rooms could be heard. On top of that, the interior lacks character and wifi in the rooms is missing too. Breakfast left a lot to be desired, with a small selection and no fresh meals. The hotel does however feature a small pool.

summ_a: This hotel may not be the right option for some. The hotel is only a five minute walk from the Town Hall rail station and you can also walk to shopping and tourist attractions from the hotel. The hotel is also close to Darling Harbour. The corner-room was of an okay size and really cleaned to a high level. Check-in to your room can be earlier if you ask. The staff were quite nice overall but sometimes seemed to be put off and lacking. The breakfast provided by the hotel was Continental., but there were problems with not being on the necessary list. The hotel's restaurant was good., but slightly expensive. The hotel were very helpful with pre-booking information, but check out of the stay was drawn out and frustrating.
summ_b: This hotel may not be the best fit for some, however it is located only a five minute walk from the Town Hall rail station. Shopping and tourist attractions are within walking distance, and Darling Harbour is close by. The corner-room was of a decent size and very clean. An earlier check-in can be organised with request. The staff were generally quite friendly, but there were occasions when they seemed to be disinterested. The Continental breakfast was provided by the hotel, however some issues occurred with people not being on the necessary list. The hotel's restaurant was good quality but costlier than expected. The hotel staff were able to provide helpful pre-booking information, although getting checked out was laborious and frustrating.
summ_comm: This lodging option may not be ideal for everyone, however it is just a five minute walk from the Town Hall rail station. Walking-distance to shopping, sightseeing, and Darling Harbour. The corner room was of a suitable size and very tidy. It is possible to arrange for early check-in, if requested. Most staff were friendly, but there were a few times when they didn't seem to be paying attention. The hotel provided Continental breakfast but there were reports of some people not being recognized as a registered guest. The eatery at the hotel was of good quality yet more pricey than anticipated. The staff was helpful with pre-booking proceedings, even though checking out created time-consuming and irritating problems.

summ_a: This is a perfect hotel for a short stay and highly recommended because of the great value for money. The hotel is in a great location if you're looking to visit the Musee d'Orsay or Saint Germain area . Firstly the rooms are designed to be really unique and it shows, but this doesn't compromise the plethora of mod-cons supplied such as iPod dock, minibar, a flat-screen television. There is nothing you could need that isn't available. Whilst very lux inside the room it's very relaxing and charming. The staff at this hotel are really caring with a great attitude. The breakfast provided by the hotel was suitable stocked with fresh, organic produce and there was plenty of food available. The ticket provided by the hotel allows for skipping the line at designated venues.
summ_b: This hotel is the perfect place to stay for a short period and is strongly recommended due to its amazing value for money. If you hope to visit the Musee d'Orsay or Saint Germain, it is conveniently located. The rooms not only have their own unique atmosphere, but also provide plenty of modern amenities, such as an iPod dock, minibar, and flat-screen TV for your comfort. The staff are very warm and welcoming, and the hotel's breakfast features lots of fresh, organic items to choose from. Additionally, with their ticket, you get the privilege of skipping the line at designated venues.
summ_comm: This accommodation is highly recommended due to its outstanding cost-effectiveness for a short stay. Whether you're looking to visit the Musee d'Orsay or Saint Germain, the hotel's convenient location makes it easy. In addition to having its own characteristic vibe, the rooms offer a host of modern amenities, such as an iPod dock, minibar and flat-screen TV, so you can kick back in ultimate comfort. The staff are friendly and helpful, and the breakfast buffet offers plenty of breakfast options made with organic components. What's more, with their ticket you can avoid waiting in long lineups at partnered venues.

summ_a: After booking directly with the hotel it was really impressive and made for a very special weekend. This is the place to be. The hotel was situated close to a metro station, allowing travel to the restaurants of Old Montreal and within walking distance of the Montreal Jazz Festival. The rooms are adequately sized but are clean and with elegant furnishings. The rooms retain some history from its previous incarnation as a bank. The rooms have free WiFi available with lovely modern art too. The hotel has a good bar that is ideal for relaxing whilst listening to some live music. The hotel had no street noise at all and on Friday and Saturday evenings there was a music group playing at the bar area.
summ_b: Reserving accommodation directly with the hotel was remarkably effective and created a memorable weekend. This place is a must see. The establishment is near a metro station which facilitates travelling to delightful eateries in Old Montreal and is a brief walk to the Montreal Jazz Festival. The moderate-sized rooms are tidy and offer tasteful decorations. They also sustain some of the past banking heritage. There is unhindered WiFi with decorative, contemporary art pieces decorating the walls. The bar is admirable for soothing tunes and to linger over a drink. The hotel is surprisingly silent and on Fridays and Saturdays, visitors can enjoy live music in the bar area.
summ_comm: Booking a stay directly with the hotel was remarkably successful, creating a weekend for the ages. This spot is unmissable! It isn't far from a metro station, making it easy to visit delightful restaurants in Old Montreal, as well as close enough to the Montreal Jazz Festival. The moderate-sized rooms are neat and decorated tastefully including some preserved banking relics. Unhindered WiFi along with modern art decorating the halls is also provided. At the bar you can stay and sip a drink while listening to calming tunes. Lastly, the hotel is surprisingly quiet, with live music sets provided from Fridays to Saturdays in the bar.

summ_a: The hotel was a bargain and comes highly recommended. The hotel is located centrally to the main strip and generally everything is within walking distance. It is a minute's walk to beach and nearby 4th street has a selection of local restaurants too. The rooms were clean and well maintained. They were reasonably priced and the deluxe options have a balcony overlooking 5th Avenue. The staff are incredibly knowledgeable about the local area and will happily spend some time advising on the best places to see. They were even gracious enough to book taxis to the airport, which is a great touch. The hotel is near to Rancho Punto Venado, which provides facilities for many outdoor activities such as horseback riding and ATV driving
summ_b: This hotel is a steal and definitely worth the recommendation. It is situated in the middle of the tourist district, so everything is within an easy walk. You can even to get to the beach in only one minute! Furthermore, 4th Street is great for dining out close-by. The rooms are nice, tidy, and reasonably priced with deluxe rooms having a balcony facing 5th Avenue. The staff are incredibly helpful and can tell you about the best attractions and can help for transportation to the airport, which is a nice extra. Lastly, Rancho Punto Venado is located conveniently, where you can experience all sorts of outdoors activities such as horseback riding and ATV driving.
summ_comm: This hotel is a great is a great value and comes highly recommended. It is centrally located in the touristic area, so it is within a short stroll of all the local attractions. Additionally, you can reach the beach in just one minute! Furthermore, 4th Street provides many nearby dining options. The rooms are clean and neat, with deluxe rooms having a balcony that overlooks 5th Avenue. The staff is friendly and very helpful in providing information on the attractions and arranging transportation to the airport. Finally, near the hotel is Rancho Punto Venado, where you can take part in a variety of outdoor activities, such as horseback riding and ATV driving.

summ_a: The hotel was a unique experience with traditional and modern features. A stay at the hotel comes highly recommended. The hotel is situated in an excellent location on the Grand Canal, only a couple of stops to San Marco Square and near to the Salute Church. It is close to a number of art galleries and the Vaporetto. The hotel has rooms overlooking the canal that are nice and clean. The hotel has a simple menu which can be served wherever you like. The minibar is always stocked for guests. Despite being a bit overpriced the hotel did live up to that expectation, so it was worth it.
summ_b: Staying at the hotel is a highly recommended experience, blending modern and traditional elements throughout. It is conveniently located near the Grand Canal, just a short ride away from San Marco Square and near to the Salute Church. Additionally, art galleries and the Vaporetto are also in close proximity. Rooms overlooking the canal are neat and tidy. The food selection is straightforward and can be served anywhere at the hotel. Plus, the minibar is always fully-stocked. The cost for the hotel may seem a bit pricey, but it does manage to be worth it in the end.
summ_comm: Staying at this accommodation is indeed an exceptional experience, as it brings together the old and the new. Located not too far from the Grand Canal, it is a short journey away from the iconic St. Mark's Square and the Chiesa della Salute. In addition, there are also art galleries and the Vaporetto close by. The rooms facing the canal are beautifully kept, and you can expect a no-fuss but tasty menu, to be served in any part of the hotel. Furthermore, the mini-bar will always have a supply of items. summ_a: It was such a comfortable experience here at this hotel and nice bonus there was classical music that came from a nearby opera school. Excellent location for that is on a quiet street, but also allow easy reach for principal city sights; the metro and city tour bus stop are really close. Clean and large room with a great renovated bathroom. The staff are a wealth of knowledge about the nearby restaurants , side trips, which was was super helpful. The breakfast not only has lots of choice but the quality of the continental foods and drinks on offer was great. They also provide take away breakfast. No wireless internet in the rooms, only available in the lobby.
summ_b: My stay at this hotel was wonderfully comfortable, and a nice bonus was the classical music that emanated from the nearby opera school. Its location was excellent - on a quiet street while still being within easy reach of the major city attractions, as well as the metro and tourist bus stops. The room I stayed in was clean and spacious, with a nicely renovated bathroom. The staff were immensely knowledgeable about the restaurants in the area and nearby side trips, which was extremely helpful. Not only was there an abundance of choices for breakfast, the quality of the continental foods and drinks was superb. They even allowed guests to take away the breakfast. The only downside was that there was
summ_comm:
nt a full-service gym.

I was so pleased with my experience at this lodging - it was incredibly comfortable and the concert hall next door playing classical music was a great bonus. Its location was fantastic - nestled in a peaceful neighborhood but still close to the major sights of the city, plus the metro and tour bus stops. The room was spotless and large, with a freshly updated restroom. The staff had comprehensive knowledge of all the local restaurants and day trips, so helpful! My breakfast selection was outstanding, with delicious continental treats, and they were even kind enough to let me take away the rest. The only thing that was missing was a complete fitness center.
